arrivalLines.lineString: Left, right.
Up and around.
You toss the rags of your makeshift bed like you're making a salad.
Not that it helps. There's no magic angle that'll make the stonework below any kinder on your bones.
But it's something to do. The guards outside have responded to none of your taunts and staring at the sky got old just a week into your sentence.
There's a <color=#00ffffff>stick</color> in the cell, I guess? Maybe you could poke a guard next time they drop by to throw food at you.
CLINK CLACLINK
Wait. That's new. What was that sound?
You're fairly sure it came from your <color=#00ffffff>right</color>.

visitedLines.lineString: You return to the middle of your cell and face an alcove shrouded in shadow. The darkened corner of the <color=#00ffffff>wall</color> kind of creeps you out.

arrivalLines.lineString: You squint at the light, only barely making out a silhouette dissappearing from view.
Until now you never even realized just how much the solitude got to you but the prospect of finally, actually talking to someone gives you a literal adrenaline rush.
You take a deep breath in and...

visitedLines.lineString: You keep eyeing the window. It makes little sense but you wish your mysterious helper would come back to talk to you...

arrivalLines.lineString: You turn to face the big slab of metal keeping you locked in. If nothing else they left the window open.
The soft glow of the torches peeks through the hatch and paints the walls arround it in red. It's the only warm part of this cell.
If you wanted to, you could put your hands through the bars and warm your hands on a torch. Luckily you haven't felt the need for that yet.
You wince at the thought of having to spend winter here. Would your jailer just let you rot from frostbite...?
Best not to think about that.

visitedLines.lineString: The soft glow of the torch peeks through the hatch and illuminates the exit. If only you could actually use it...

arrivalLines.lineString: There is no hesitation in your gait. Whatever's in front of you can't be any worse than wasting away in a cell.
Are you nervous? Yes. But you hold on tight to your torch and hope it'll last for however long this passage is.
Actually, scratch that. You know it will. You will make it out of this place.
Step by step, you make your way down into the darkness...
And that's that!
This is less a game/demo for a larger thing and more me just experimenting with json and adventure game stuff.
So thanks for sticking around until the end! C:
Now, choose one of the options below to exit or restart the scene:

answerValues.lineString: You tried sleeping there once thinking the little indent would keep you safe from the wind but it was surprisingly drafty.
Rock solid, you're not getting out this way. Surprisingly warm to the touch though...
A strange <color=#00ffffff>key</color>. There has to be some <color=#00ffffff>use</color> for it.
Is? This a key? It sure doesn't look like one but what else could it do. Would make for a very poor fork. Anyways, it has to have some kind of use...

choiceResult1.lineString: You couldn't help yourself. The moment those words leave your lips you bring a hand to your mouth.
Idiot! You're in prison and someone just dropped you something and you just go yell about it to everyone in ear shot?!
Your cheeks go flush in embarassment as you shake your head.
You tilt your head and listen, waiting for the guards to barge in but... They never come. Odd.
After taking a moment to cool down, you make a mental note to apologize to whoever that was then turn to look at what they left behind.
The bars are still intact but... What's that on the ground?
Shiny and metal. Your eyes widen in anticipation. A <color=#00ffffff>key</color>, hopefully?

choiceResult2.lineString: You're in prison, buddy. If you were sneaking around cells and doing shady shit, the last thing you'd want is for the person you're helping to alert all the guards about it.
So yeah, good thinking on your part. You give yourself a mental pat on the back and look around to see what they did.
The bars are still intact but... What's that on the ground?
It's shiny. Your eyes widen in anticipation. It better be a <color=#00ffffff>key</color>.

startingLines.lineString: Hello and thanks for playing <color=#00ffffff>Dungeon Escape</color>!
A word before we begin, I'd like to explain the controls real quick.
To move around the scene, type commands like <color=#00ffffff>move left</color> or <color=#00ffffff>go to door</color>.
I reccommend sticking to one-word commands like <color=#00ffffff>look, inspect, use</color> etc.
You can also type <color=#00ffffff>exit</color> at any point to quit the game.
That about wraps it up! When you're ready to begin, choose the <color=#00ffffff>start</color> option below to... well, start the game.

errorMessages: I'm not sure what you're trying to say.
Those words make no sense to me.
What? I don't get it. What are you trying to say?
I'm not sure I follow. What are you trying to say?
Come again? Could you rephrase that?
